What is Whiff? 
Whiff is a packet sniffer application based on the Android Operating System, which capture records of packets within the network.


Who is it for? 
It is for users that comes from different spectrums of experiences, from beginners who are curious about how packet sniffing works to people who are fluent in the domain of packet capturing and network administration.


Why doesn’t it run for me? 
Whiff can only work if the operating system running it is on Android 5.1, Lollipop and above.


Why am I unable to scan for any packets? 
Check that you are connected to a network as network sniffing is not possible without the device being connected to a network.


How do I install the apk file? 
Go to Settings on your phone and switch to the “general” tab, if needed. 
Tick the checkbox next to the “Unknown Sources” option. 
Confirm the warning message by tapping on “OK”. 
Go to the directory where the whiff.apk file is downloaded and install it.
